contents.Text: [[[underline:Soft Purple]]] ≈ Manage Keys
[[[underline:Soft Yellow]]] ≈ Save Changes to disc
[[[underline:Dark Blue]]] ≈ Key
[[[underline:Light Green]]] ≈ Active
[[[underline:Pale Orange]]] ≈ Executable
[[[underline:Soft Peach]]] ≈ Codec
[[[underline:Deep Green]]] ≈ YT_dlp_args
[[[underline:Cyan Blue]]] ≈ Main
[[[underline:Crimson Red]]] ≈ Main Keys
Allows the user to manage (Add,Remove) dropdowns and dropdown body's
This adds a new Key/Playlist
This removes selected Key/Playlist
This hides the add/remove dropdown
Simply saves all changes made to disk (apon changes the button colour is set to red)
Key holds the name and data of a playlist or list of urls
This enables or disables the key for download
(disabled means it will not download anything in the disabled key)
This is the executable for helping with the download process
This field is no longer needed but is here for flexibility in the future
This is the container/format you will save the songs into
Lossy vs Lossless:
Lossy codecs: compress audio by removing some data, resulting in smaller file sizes but reduced quality.
Lossless codecs: retain all original audio data, providing higher quality at the cost of larger file sizes.
Codecs to choose from
- AAC: Lossy codec with better quality than MP3.
- ALAC: Apple's lossless codec for high-quality playback.
- FLAC: Lossless codec for audiophile-grade music.
- M4A: Container for AAC or ALAC audio, primarily used in Apple ecosystem.
- MP3: Classic lossy codec with decent quality but outdated.
- Opus: Advanced codec for optimal quality-to-efficiency ratio with variable bitrates.
- Vorbis (Ogg): Open-source lossy codec with good quality at low bitrates; the 'grandpa' of Opus.
- WAV: Uncompressed format for highest audio quality, but large file sizes.
NOTE: Opus and m4a are not natively supported by "RhythmiRust"
since there is no opus,m4a decoder published yet so these two formats use a fallback when playing them
This are customizable arguments on how you want to download
This is a very advanced subject so for normal users starting from 0 top to bottom use option 1 (with thumbnails) or 3 (without thumbnails)
For those advanced users who want to customize or understand these in depth here is the page for that[[[button:Advanced args page][YT_dlp_args]]]
However i will mention arguments in YT_dlp args that "RhythmiRust" added:
file_path_clone: Is replaced with the path of the target directory where a song will be downloaded into
item_clone: This is the "URL" that will be passed to yt-dlp
codec: Is replaced with the songs codec
ffmpeg-path: Target of the ffmpeg binary in the config (so the user does not need to install ffmpeg manually and so "RhythmiRust" can manage ffmpeg itself)
This holds the list of urls/keys
This is a Key/url where you save information into
test1 if the item name of another key
"Add Name here" is the what the playlist folder will be called in the download folder
For example you input a name of "playlist/hi" then it will make a dir called "playlist" then inside make a dir called "hi" then it will download into "hi"
"Add url here" is where you add the urls you want to download into that folder
Hit "save" once you are done then "save changes" to finalize them
